channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 particularly large pothole going down away from the racecourse, but a number of potholes on the road, 23rd January
item.description:
Down New Barn Lane away from the racecourse, mostly near the verge sound. Been like this for some time now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Pot holes, some at the joint with previous repairs, 23rd January
item.description:
At the junction with Mew Barn Close and continuing west up New Barn Lane. In the part of the road where cyclists ride and towards the middle of the road, causing vehicles to swerve left and right to avoid them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 185, New Barn Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dinner sized hole but very deep, 23rd January
item.description:
Scare.voters.raced is the What Three Words location this hole although about 12" in circumference is very deep and the rocks from the hole are being left on the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Clyde Crescent, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes, 23rd January
item.description:
This road has been patched up more times than a quilt. Besides being lumpy/bumpy to drive on, several new potholes have appeared. They start just as you turn into Kyderminster Road and go all the way up as far as Whitmore Road varying in size and depth. Rather than patching them up, can this part of the road be completely resurfaced once and for all please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insanely deep/large hole, 23rd January
item.description:
This is not a pothole, it is absolutely huge and I've just hit it. What am I paying road tax for?! This has already been reported by others. If my car is damaged I will NOT be happy!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Pot Holes, 23rd January
item.description:
There is not just one pothole here. If the first 1 or 2 don't get you the 3rd one will. Usually, during daylight there are cars parked here but at night when there are no cars parked you can't see the potholes until you hit them as they are on the driving line
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 138, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive new pothole, 23rd January
item.description:
On the inside of the road going up the hill. Right where your near side tyre would be.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain is raised above newly resurfaced road so water pools along the entire side of road, 22nd January
item.description:
Alomg the fron of numbers 38 to 40. Puddle forms a few inches deep with relatively light rain. Makes parking there a nightmare aswell as cross the road having to jump over. Would be concerned for the properties if a heavy downpour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linworth Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Large pothole on the raised speed cushions, 22nd January
item.description:
The first pair of speed cushions as you leave Ambleside Road/street in the direction of Chosen Hill school. Even when slow to drive over speed cushion; cannot safely navigate around the pothole without venturing across centre of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: At least 30cm x 30cm, 22nd January
item.description:
The same pot hole year in year out, just dig up the hole section
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous large potholes, 22nd January
item.description:
Very dangerous large potholes. Deeper than tennis ball. Causing traffic issues especially as London Road (A40) is closed. A school is very close by with children walking, numerous cars parked, blocked traffic whilst trying to avoid these huge potholes. Need fixing ASAP. The length of Hearne Road needs fully resurfacing. Over 10 deep big potholes. Sadly can only upload 3 pictures.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Hearne Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous DEEP BUG potholes, 22nd January
item.description:
There are so many big deep potholes on the length of Hearne Road, over 10. They are deeper than a tennis ball. They are dangerous. The road is very close to schools. And as A40 is closed at one end of Hearne Rd it is getting used far more. The road closure is causing huge issues and the state of this road is making the situation even harder for all. Especially when dark and full of water. This road is a disgrace and the entire road needs resurfacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Hearne Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road looks neglected, as if the Council spent the entire maintenance budget building a cycle path that nobody will use...oh wait..., 22nd January
item.description:
The whole road between the traffic lights at Blaisdon Way and Pilgrove Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
